sentence: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJI) has left behind a tough 2015, which was nothing but a tale of agony relating to the slump in oil prices , international crises combined with concerns over a Fed rate hike and a strengthening dollar.
These factors largely weighed on the markets, with the Dow index closing 2.3% down year-to-date at $17,425.03 on New Year's Eve.
Though the overall index told a heart breaking story, not all components of the Dow lost in 2015.
One such performer was the home improvement retailer Home Depot Inc.HD , which gained over 27%.
The stock displayed steady growth opening trade at $105.16 a share on Jan 2, 2015 and climbing to $132.25 per share on Dec 31.
This Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) stock looks promising and has a long-term earnings growth rate of 14.2%.
The company delivered positive earnings surprises in seven consecutive quarters.

In the trailing four quarters, this Atlanta-based company outperformed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by an average of 4%, including a positive surprise of 2.3% delivered in the third quarter of fiscal 2015.
Home Depot is a leading player in the highly fragmented home improvement industry.

The company has been implementing several initiatives to drive long-term growth, including the widening of its range of premium products and opening new stores, along with expanding its online capabilities.
Similarly, we have handpicked four other stocks that outperformed the Dow in 2015 and hold potential to boost your portfolio in 2016.
On top of the list is Nike Inc.NKE , which surged nearly 31.5% in 2015 to close at $62.50.
This Beaverton, OR-based sporting goods retailer delivered positive earnings surprises consecutively for nearly 14 quarters, with an average beat of 9.4% recorded over the trailing four quarters.
In the second quarter of fiscal 2016, the company reported a positive earnings surprise of 4.7%.
Nike has been gaining from its customer-centric approach, innovative products and strong portfolio.
Further, the company's better-than-expected order outlook and positive guidance for 2016 highlight its prospects.
Also, this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock is positioned to live up to everyone's expectations with a long-term earnings growth rate of 14.1%.
Next is McDonald's Corp.MCD which outperformed the Dow, recording 26.7% growth in 2015.
McDonald's reported a 10.2% beat in the third quarter.
The company delivered positive earnings surprises in five straight quarters, with an average beat of 4.96% for the trailing four quarters.
Oak Brook, IL-based McDonald's is the world's largest chain of fast-food restaurants, serving over 100 countries.
This Zacks Rank #2 stock has historically enjoyed moderate growth prospects with its exposure to under-penetrated international markets.
The company has a long-term earnings growth rate of 8.4%.

The spotlight now falls on the diversified technology and financial services firm General Electric CompanyGE , which witnessed 24.3% growth in 2015, with an average beat of 7.1% over the trailing four quarters.
In third-quarter 2015, the company reported a positive earnings surprise of 23.1%.
Further, this Zacks Rank #3 company is poised for long-term growth given its increased focus on core business activities.
The company is restructuring its portfolio by divesting most of the GE Capital assets to redefine itself as a core industrial entity.
The company remains well on track to close asset sale transactions of $100 billion by 2015.
Also, the Fairfield, CT-based company has a long-term earnings growth rate of 7.9%.
Last but not least on the list, is the global entertainment giant The Walt Disney CompanyDIS , which recorded growth of nearly 12.7% in 2015.
This Burbank, CA-based media company has reported positive earnings surprises for nine straight quarters, with an average positive surprise of 8.8% over the trailing four quarters.
For the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015, the company reported earnings surprise of 2.6%.
In 2015, Walt Disney grabbed all the attention with box office hits like Avengers: Age of Ultron , Ant-Man , Inside Out , Cinderella and Star Wars: The Force Awakens .
Clearly, the company tasted repeated success at the box office last year, raking in more than $5 billion.
The company's success story so far and an impressive line-up of big budget movies up to 2017, narrate an even better performance for the future.
This is also seconded by the Zacks Rank #3 company's long-term earnings growth rate of 9.7%.
The Dow stands in the red even at the start of 2016 as not much has changed with the global economic situation, the oil prices or the surging U.S. dollar.
Also, several analysts project that volatility will heighten going forward.
However, most stocks that form part of its components remain poised for growth due to their inherent strength and management efforts to step up business.
On a separate note, the domestic economy is back to track and stands to gain from the recent rate hike announcement.
This raises our optimism on the markets, which may bounce back as the year proceeds.
All said, we believe the aforementioned stocks could boost your returns, making this a happy and prosperous New Year for you.
